item.title: Jurors or Murderers? A Paradox of Justice
item.description: Book Review: Murder on the Orient Express SPOILER ALERT! The book review may reveal key plots Famed crime novelist Agatha Christie published the classic Murder on the Orient Express in 1934. It is set on the Orient express on its journey from Vienna to Istanbul. One day, a passenger is found dead, stabbed 12 times. The train is stalled by heavy snowdrift, and the renowned Belgian detective Hercule Poirot’s trip is interrupted to investigate the case.

item.title: Door and Road of Socialism - The Epic Meeting of Honecker and Mao
item.description: course thesis: introduction to Mao Zedong thoughts and theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristic This fiction does not represent the author political position. To my mind, the so-called “socialist society” is not anything immutable. Like all other social formations, it should be conceived in a state of constant flux and change. ——Friedrich Engels On October 29, 1976, the General Secretary of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany, Erich Honecker, was elected chairman of the Council of State of German Democratic Republic.

item.title: Critiques on the Grimms' Fairy Tales - Princess Syndrome
item.description: Mid-Term Report of the Course German Romantism During the first half of the semester, we read and performed four fairy tales: The Frog Prince, King Thrushbeard, Cinderella and Little Red Riding Hood. Except for Little Red Riding Hood, the other three heroines in the fairy tales all married a prince. They are either a princess with high social status, or a poor girl with ordinary background. But what do these three princesses have in common?

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello, I am Lanlan. I study Automotive Engineering at School of Vehicle and Mobility, Tsinghua University, Beijing, P.R. China. I like reading books, drawing pictures, playing soccer and learning foreign languages. In this website you can find some of my projects, artworks and book reviews. Education Tsinghua University School of Vehicle and Mobility Automotive Engineering BEng, GPA: 3.76 / 4.0, Rank: 1 / 7 Beijing, China Aug. 2015 - Jul.
